article_text:
ISTANBUL—The corruption probe rocking Turkish politics has snared high-profile allies of Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan, including ministers' relatives and bank executives. But the most recognizable face is construction tycoon and self-styled "king of real estate" Ali Agaoglu.

The founding chairman of Agaoglu Group, one of Turkey's largest construction companies, was one of more than 50 people detained in dawn raids in...

twitter.description: The corruption probe that is rocking Turkish politics has snared a string of high-profile allies of Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan, including ministers' relatives and bank executives. But the most recognizable face so far caught in the dragnet is construction tycoon and self-styled "king of real estate" Ali Agaoglu.

twitter.title: Turkey's Corruption Probe Snares Real-Estate 'King'
